DataElement.preferredName: Organ System Genital Dryness or Discomfort Symptom Severity Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the severity of vaginal or penile, foreskin dryness/discomfort.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Organ System Genital Dryness Or Discomfort Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system._The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis._The lack of natural or normal moisture._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Property.preferredDefinition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.:The lack of natural or normal moisture.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.
The lack of natural or normal moisture.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 17-C-0027 Chronic GVHD Review of Systems History Screening form. mc 1/11/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not severe or strong; far from extreme; not serious enough to endanger life.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
